channel.title: Favorite TFC Class
channel.description:
I've seen at least three other people mention preferring an older TFC class in the [url=https://www.blackmesasource.com/forums/showthread.php?t=1744]TF2 class thread[/url]. Sure, the TF2 characters were given a little bit more personality to help with marketing, but the classes played very differently back in the day. They deserve their own thread.
I'm a Pyro fan, of course. The player models both look perfect for the job of handling fire, and the weapons are easy to use but extremely difficult to master. A good enough pyro will begin to upset enemies by endlessly setting them on fire, obstructing their views. An [i]upset[/i] enemy is an [i]irrational[/i] enemy (if you can dig Zeno).
He's also usually the least selfish of classes, able to wound many enemies but having a harder time when it comes to killing. When somebody plays pyro, you know they're of noble character. ([url=https://www.vgcats.com/comics/?strip_id=46]Or maybe just bat-shit insane.[/url])
Finally, it's a very liberating class to play, because pyros don't get involved in a whole lot of ethics.* While medics are scorned for infecting-and-running, it's an accepted strategy as a pyro to ignite-and-flee. * Demomen are bastards when they camp resupply rooms, but a naplm grenade is [i]supposed[/i] to sit outside of the enemy spawn. * Heavy weapons guys are always whores, but when a pyro sets you on fire, it's your own damn fault no matter [i]how[/i] much he was spamming his rockets. * Scouts and medics who are constantly bunnyhopping+concing don't deserve any respect, but IC-jumps are perfectly balanced, and 2Fort, I'mma let you finish your round, but Badlands was one of the best CTF maps [u]of all time[/u] thanks to IC-jumping into the flag room.
